decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on milling the opponent's deck using cards like Ruin Crab and into the Story, while also leveraging creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief to deal direct damage. With a mix of removal spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, along with counterspells like Essence Scatter and Saw It Coming, the deck aims to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, providing recurring value from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using removal spells and countermagic to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes powerful threats like Goldspan Dragon and Valki, God of Lies to quickly close out the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for flexibility in casting spells of all colors. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently answering threats and deploying its own powerful creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays using strong creatures like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, and Brushfire Elemental to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of power cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge provide additional damage and card advantage. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around a proactive game plan that aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the board while setting up for powerful late-game threats like Goldspan Dragon and Shark Typhoon. Cosima, God of the Voyage provides card advantage and Brazen Borrower offers versatility. Faceless Haven is a resilient threat that can close out games quickly. The mana base is optimized for both colors and includes snow lands for synergy with Frost Bite. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents with its control elements and finish the game with its high-impact creatures.

This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Drown in the Loch, and Lullmage's Domination to counter threats and mill their deck. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber to apply pressure and fuel game-winning cards like Into the Story. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and a companion like Lurrus of the Dream-Den for added value, this Control deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient and powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental. The goal is to apply pressure early in the game and maintain momentum throughout with cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave. Showdown of the Skalds helps refill your hand and provide additional resources. The deck also includes removal options like Shatterskull Smashing and Embereth Shieldbreaker to disrupt your opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggression and resilience, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence with aggressive creatures such as Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. Embercleave provides a powerful finisher, while Shatterskull Smashing and Showdown of the Skalds offer additional resources and damage potential. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provides flexibility and additional creature threats. The land base ensures consistent mana production for casting spells and activating abilities. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed, power, and resilience.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, card advantage, and powerful threats. It utilizes a wide range of versatile spells to handle different types of threats, while also generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emergent Ultimatum to close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra value.

The core idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Questing Beast, and Brushfire Elemental, backed up by powerful removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure to the opponent and finish the game quickly with cards like Embercleave and Rimrock Knight. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Edgewall Innkeeper provide additional card advantage, allowing the deck to continue applying pressure even in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant to put pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes powerful cards like Questing Beast and Embercleave to deal massive damage and close out games. The Great Henge provides card advantage and life gain, while Shatterskull Smashing offers removal and reach. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful threats and efficient removal spells, using the Gruul colors to maximize aggression and board presence.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Bonecrusher Giant while utilizing powerful equipment like Embercleave to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate to generate card advantage and additional threats. The inclusion of removal spells like Embereth Shieldbreaker and Shatterskull Smashing helps maintain control of the battlefield, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on countering opponent's spells, dealing damage with instant-speed spells like Frost Bite and Shatterskull Smashing, generating card advantage with Behold the Multiverse and Saw It Coming, and creating threats with Shark Typhoon and Goldspan Dragon. It also includes versatile creatures like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant, as well as lands that provide both mana fixing and snow-covered lands synergy. The deck aims to control the board, disrupt opponent's game plan, and win through incremental advantage and efficient threats.

The main concept of this Naya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of creatures and powerful spells to quickly close out the game. By including efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, along with combat tricks like Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of card draw engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge helps to ensure a steady stream of threats while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board using a combination of creatures and spells that disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a focus on sacrificing and stealing opponent's creatures, as well as dealing direct damage, this deck aims to maintain board presence while also maintaining card advantage through effects like Village Rites. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Kroxa and Rankle, along with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Heartless Act, allows the deck to quickly close out games through aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on using control elements to manage the board and disrupt opponents while ramping up to powerful late-game threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Genesis Ultimatum. It aims to control the game early on with cards like Jwari Disruption and Fire Prophecy, while also ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Beanstalk Giant. The deck can generate card advantage with Mazemind Tome and finish games with huge threats like Goldspan Dragon and Shark Typhoon. It looks to overwhelm opponents with its late-game power and inevitability.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with small creatures quickly, utilizing them to apply pressure on the opponent while gaining life and generating value from various synergies. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through flickering creatures for more ETB triggers. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of weenies backed up by powerful enablers like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Luminarch Aspirant, while maintaining board presence and card advantage through cards like Luminous Broodmoth and Castle Ardenvale.
